messages.title: A fresh voice at Westminster
messages.content: I have worked across Cambridgeshire in Community Education and have taught UNISON healthcare workers courses at Hinchingbrooke Hospital. My current job is campaigning to get people with learning disabilities the social care they need. I am an experienced Labour councillor and would bring this commitment to listening and working with local people as your MP.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Taking practical action to prevent climate change including long-term reduction of carbon emissions.
Making sure people are able to live in affordable homes in our rural communities.
A guaranteed job or training place for 18-24 year olds after six months out of work.
Reducing the pay gap, preventing disability discrimination, and fighting racism.
The right to see a cancer specialist within 2 weeks and a diagnostic test result within 1 week.

issues.economy: 22 million people have benefited from tax cuts and lower mortgage repayments that have raised real incomes at a critical time.
issues.education: As a mum Anthea knows that Labour’s investment into schools means that every British child has a better education.

housing.content: Making sure people are able to live in affordable homes in our rural communities.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am campaigning to get people with learning disabilities the social care they need. I am an experienced Labour councillor and would bring this commitment to listening and working with local people as your MP.

endorsements.endorsement: I have worked with Anthea for several years. She will be a great MP.

images.caption: Anthea Cox a fresh voice at Westminster
